dt: {bc}belonging to or maintained by the federal government
{bc}of, relating to, or being a coalition {dx_def}see {dxt|coalition||2}{/dx_def} government formed by most or all major political parties usually in a crisis

shortdef: of or relating to a nation
comprising or characteristic of a nationality

dt: {bc}one that owes allegiance to or is under the protection of a {a_link|nation} without regard to the more formal status of citizen or subject
{bc}a competition that is national in scope

pt: {sc}citizen{/sc} {sc}subject{/sc} {sc}national{/sc} mean a person owing allegiance to and entitled to the protection of a sovereign state. {sc}citizen{/sc} is preferred for one owing allegiance to a state in which sovereign power is retained by the people and sharing in the political rights of those people.
{sc}subject{/sc} implies allegiance to a personal sovereign such as a monarch.
{sc}national{/sc} designates one who may claim the protection of a state and applies especially to one living or traveling outside that state.

pt.t: American {it}nationals{/it} working in the Middle East

shortdef: one that owes allegiance to or is under the protection of a nation without regard to the more formal status of citizen or subject
a competition that is national in scope —usually used in plural

dt: {bc}a bank operating under federal charter and supervision

shortdef: a bank operating under federal charter and supervision

dt: {bc}a usually forested area of considerable extent that is preserved by government decree from private exploitation and is harvested only under supervision

shortdef: a usually forested area of considerable extent that is preserved by government decree from private exploitation and is harvested only under supervision

dt: {bc}a military establishment serving as a national constabulary and defense force
{bc}a militia force recruited by each state of the U.S., equipped by the federal government, and jointly maintained subject to the call of either

shortdef: a military establishment serving as a national constabulary and defense force
a militia force recruited by each state of the U.S., equipped by the federal government, and jointly maintained subject to the call of either
a member of a national guard

dt: {bc}the aggregate of earnings from a nation's current production including compensation of employees, interest, rental income, and profits of business after taxes

shortdef: the aggregate of earnings from a nation's current production including compensation of employees, interest, rental income, and profits of business after taxes

dt: {bc}a place of historic, scenic, or scientific interest set aside for preservation usually by presidential proclamation

shortdef: a place of historic, scenic, or scientific interest set aside for preservation usually by presidential proclamation

shortdef: an area of special scenic, historical, or scientific importance set aside and maintained by a national government and in the U.S. by an act of Congress

shortdef: a recreational area adjacent to a seacoast and maintained by the federal government
